antichess.ai
Class AIJob<M extends Move,B extends Board<M>>

java.lang.Object
  antichess.ai.AIJob<M,B>

public class AIJob<M extends Move,B extends Board<M>>
extends Object

An AIJob is a game tree node to be evaluated by a MinimaxAI.AIThread

Specification Fields
  • board : B // The Board to be evaluated
  • move : M // The Move to evaluate on the board
  • depth : int // The depth to which to evaluate the board
  • bestMove : AIMove // The best move found so far from the parent of the board in the game tree
  • beta : int // The value of beta for alpha-beta pruning the search
  • tryMove : AIMove // A line of moves that the caller has reason to believe represents a good move from board after making move

Field Detail

board

public B extends Board<M> board
The board to be evaluated

move

public M extends Move move
The move to evaluate on the board

bestMove

public AIMove<M extends Move> bestMove
The best move found so far for the parent of the board in the game tree. This will be updated by threads as they complete their search.

beta

public int beta
The value of beta for alpha-beta pruning the search

tryMove

public AIMove<M extends Move> tryMove
A line of moves that the caller has reason to believe represents a good move from board after making move. This may be null. Specifying a move here does not change the semantics of the method, but specifying a good move may potentially speed up the search. It is not required that tryMove.move be a legal move from the given board.

AIJob

public AIJob()
